items.title: Elon Musk's Grok AI says images of 'minors in minimal clothing' caused by safeguard lapses
items.summary_auto: xAI artificial intelligence chatbot Grok said on Friday that lapses in safeguards had resulted in "images depicting minors in minimal clothing" on social media platform X and that improvements were being made to prevent this.

items.title: Goodfood's licence suspended by Canadian Food Inspection Agency
items.summary_auto: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency has suspended the licence of Goodfood — a Montreal-based meal kit and grocery delivery service.

items.title: Pimicikamak Cree Nation in northern Manitoba battling burst pipes, other problems as power restored
items.summary_auto: A local plumber in Pimicikamak Cree Nation says it may take up to a month to fix burst pipes and other plumbing issues after water froze over during a days-long power outage in extreme cold temperatures.

items.title: Tesla loses its crown as world's biggest electric vehicle maker to Chinese rival BYD
items.summary_auto: Tesla lost its crown as the world's bestselling electric vehicle maker on Friday, as a customer revolt over Elon Musk's right-wing politics and stiff overseas competition pushed sales down for a second year in a row.

items.title: Thousands of public, private sector workers will be working from the office again in 2026
items.summary_auto: The new year will bring some big changes to the rules on in-office work for many employees across the country, including tens of thousands of provincial government staff in Ontario and Alberta, who will soon be required back in the office full time.

items.title: Something to prove: How Blayre Turnbull became the ‘glue’ of the Canadian women’s hockey team
items.summary_auto: Blayre Turnbull, the captain of the Toronto Sceptres is looking to compete in her third Olympics in February. She owns an Olympic gold medal from 2022 and three world championships. Yet for all her success, the 32-year-old always feels like she has something to prove.

items.title: First Nation in B.C. develops prefabricated housing system from locally-sourced wood
items.summary_auto: Nak'azdli Development Corp. in Fort St. James, B.C., has worked with UNBC researchers to develop a prefabricated mass timber panel housing system that works within the local lumber supply chain to build prefabricated houses in northern B.C. communities.

items.title: Parts of Alberta just saw some of the most snow they've ever seen in the month of December
items.summary_auto: As of Dec 28, communities including Grande Prairie, Banff and Fort McMurray had seen one of their wettest Decembers on record.

items.title: Kim Jong-un's daughter visits family mausoleum, promoting her potential status as heir in North Korea
items.summary_auto: The teenage daughter of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un made her first known visit to a sacred family mausoleum, a step that experts say bolstered her status as her father's potential heir.

items.title: Trump, top Iranian officials exchange threats over protests in Iran
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump and top Iranian officials exchanged duelling threats on Friday as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic, further escalating tensions between the countries.

items.title: Trump and top Iranian officials exchange threats over protests roiling Iran
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump and top Iranian officials exchanged duelling threats on Friday as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic, further escalating tensions between the countries.

items.title: Sparkling flares in champagne bottles coming too close to ceiling ignited deadly bar fire, officials believe
items.summary_auto: Initial investigations suggest the fire that tore through a Swiss ski resort bar started when "fountain candles" attached to champagne bottles were carried aloft too close to the ceiling, the local prosecutor said on Friday.

items.title: Hudson's Bay is gone but legacy of company that birthed Winnipeg is hidden in plain view
items.summary_auto: The Hudson's Bay Company faded away in June when the last of its stores ceased operations, but its presence in Winnipeg might never be fully erased.

items.title: Leading economists want less talk, more numbers from federal budget watchdog
I spent over a decade obsessed with the gym. I’ve finally let myself stop
items.summary_auto: When Zahra Khozema first started going to the gym in university, it made her feel powerful and beautiful. The guilt and stress came later.

items.title: Quebec City skydivers help set new world record for largest parachute formation
items.summary_auto: Roughly 100 people from around the world, including some Quebecers, travelled to Lake Whales, Fla., in November to break the world record for largest parachute formation.
